history.content: Whether it's doable depends on you, but I'll just say that this course workload is like 2-3 times harder than your current workload. You will definitely need to spend at least twice the amount of hours you currently spend. Those are the 3 hardest lower div classes for a reason.

children.subject: Thanks for the feedback! Ill probably just stick to 61c and 70 lol and take 16b later on.

Oh lol pls don’t put off 16b. I think u would rather put off 61C (if you’re especially interested in computer architecture/low level stuff, that’s another story) to avoid being in my boat later on. I’m a rising senior now that put off 16b for way too long (not really out of choice, but anyways it happened) and now I’m stressing bc upperclassmen have 0 priority in enrollment for 16b. The more u put it off, the harder to get in the class later.
Oh shoot you right. I still have to keep enrollment priority in mind. Thanks for the heads up!
I assume you took EECS16A last semester. My suggestion for your reference: Math 54, EECS16B, and CS70 or CS61C, no research, no TA.
Thanks for the suggestion but I took 54 last semester :) I think imma roll with cs70, cs61c, and 2 breadth courses

Lol that's my schedule for last semester. It was definitely a lot of work and I only had 14 units that semester. It probably won't kill you, but you should be prepared, and you should think twice before taking on other commitments like clubs or researches. 

Comparing with your current schedule, 61c is much harder than 61a, and it focuses more on the hardware/lower-level design so previous coding experience won't help you as much; personally, I feel math 53 is kind of on the same level as 70, with some topics being harder than the others, but overall if you did ok in 53, 70 shouldn't be too bad; haven't taken physics 7b but 16b was the hardest for me, and our final average was about 55%, so it probably wasn't just me lol.

history.content:
How doable is the combination of the courses in the title? Im planning to take these courses in the fall (planning on taking cs61b over the summer) 

Currently Im taking cs61a, physics 7b, math 53, and a breadth and it isnt too bad. How is the workload of title courses compared to my current schedule?

Also any recommendations for light workload breadth courses will be greatly appreciated! :)
history.subject: EECS 16B + CS 70 + CS 61C
